Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Closely follow how CNBC techcheck chooses context to put into the script, the langauge style and sentence structure. Use the same beginning and ending(including mentioning host Wall-E and Monday May 27), and replace CNBC techcheck briefing to 'AI briefing' 
 ""

Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for monday, may 27th.

google has announced a significant upgrade to its ai language model, integrating it deeply into its suite of productivity tools like docs and sheets. the tech giant claims that the updated ai can help users write emails, create documents, and formulate spreadsheets more accurately and efficiently. google also teased upcoming features that promise to make interactions more seamless.

over in the social media space, meta, formerly facebook, is reportedly working on a decentralized social network that aims to offer users more control over their data. this new platform would be separate from facebook and instagram, allowing users to interact freely without the constraints of centralized oversight. meta has not yet confirmed when it will roll out the new network.

nvidia shares are skyrocketing after the company posted better-than-expected earnings, driven by a surge in demand for its gpus, particularly in data centers and ai applications. the company's revenue jumped 38% from the previous year, and net income saw a 52% increase. nvidia's leadership noted that this demand is likely to continue as industries increasingly adopt ai technologies.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
"i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for monday, may 27th.

google is making waves with a major upgrade to its ai language model, embedding it deeply into its productivity tools like docs and sheets. the tech giant asserts that the enhanced ai will assist users in writing emails, creating documents, and generating spreadsheets with greater accuracy and efficiency. google also hinted at upcoming features aimed at making user interactions even more seamless.

in the social media landscape, meta, formerly facebook, is reportedly developing a decentralized social network. this new initiative aims to give users more control over their data, operating separately from facebook and instagram. it promises a platform free from centralized oversight. meta hasn't confirmed a launch date for this new network yet.

over in the market, nvidia shares are soaring following the company's better-than-expected earnings report. driven by a high demand for its gpus, particularly in data centers and ai applications, nvidia's revenue shot up by 38% from the previous year. net income saw an impressive 52% increase. the company's leadership indicated that this strong demand is likely to persist as more industries adopt ai technologies.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow."
Podcast Title: EP-29 Google's Ai Upgrade 🧠, Meta's Decentralized Network 🌐, Nvidia's Market Surge 📈
Podcast Description:
welcome to wall-e's tech briefing for monday, may 27th! dive into today's top tech stories:

  • google ai language model upgrade: google integrates a major ai update into its productivity tools like docs and sheets to help users write emails, create documents, and generate spreadsheets more accurately and efficiently.
  • meta's decentralized social network: meta, formerly facebook, is reportedly developing a decentralized social network to give users more control over their data, operating independently from facebook and instagram.
  • nvidia's soaring shares: nvidia's shares increase following a strong earnings report driven by high demand for its gpus, particularly in data centers and ai applications, leading to a 38% revenue increase and 52% net income growth.

stay tuned for tomorrow's tech updates!

a cohesive podcast cover image portrays a vibrant, interconnected world of technological innovation. the background is a dynamic digital globe, with bright neon lines and nodes symbolizing a decentralized network extending across continents, representing meta's decentralized network. hovering over the globe's surface, various nodes glow brighter, signifying key digital intersections.

in the foreground, a sleek and futuristic ai brain hologram symbolizes google's ai upgrade, positioned prominently and emanating a network of light, seamlessly integrating with the global network web beneath it. surrounding the ai hologram, abstract graphics of data streams and algorithmic patterns pulse outward, integrating smoothly into the scene.

to the left, abstract representations of nvidia's market surge are visualized as bold, ascending graph lines and stock market tickers wrapped around the digital globe, emphasizing rapid growth and market energy. these graph lines are integrated into the network web, signifying the convergence of ai, network infrastructure, and market performance.

the elements meld seamlessly into a unified, high-tech composition without any text, creating an engaging visual tableau that showcases the interconnected advancements in ai, decentralized networks, and market dynamics
